page.title: 18LEISURE - CLYDACH VALE
page.content: Typical of the leisure facilities of the area are the Cambrian Welfare Park and the Workingmen's Club. The Park is owned by the Rhondda Borough Council and stands in an elevated position overlooking Clydach Vale. It has a large rugby field and new chang- ing rooms and showers were built this year. There is a fine bowling green, three tennis courts and a children's small pool is in use. The Workingmen's club is six years old and has 450 members. Entertainment include bingo, darts, snooker, skittles, disco and cabaret. Â£4,000 per month is needed to finance the club. More gentlemen than ladies use the facilities of the club. Ladies are allowed upstairs but downstairs is strictly for the men.
